intro: Hedyotis commutata, commonly known as the small flameflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or herb, featuring opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. Its small, bright yellow flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom during the warm seasons. The plant is adapted to moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along streambanks.
